course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Construction Materials Technology
course.description: Constituents of concrete; failure mechanisms and mechanical properties; advanced cementitious composites: high strength, fiber, polymer, high performance; fibrous composite materials: composition, anisotrophic behavior, engineering constant, failure criteria; non-destructive evaluation: wave, scan, ultrasonic, acoustic emission, infrared thermography.

reviews.author: engineIsGood
reviews.comment_content:
1. Green Concrete
2. Concrete Rheology and Construction Processes
3. Concrete Durability
4. Non-destructive Evaluation of Concrete
5. High Performance Concrete and Self-Compacting Concrete
6. Lightweight Concrete
7. Fiber Reinforced Concrete and Strain-Hardening Cementitious Composites
8. Applications of Polymers and Polymeric Composites in Civil Engineering
9. Anisotropic Mechanics of Laminated Polymeric Composites
10. Basic Properties of Bituminous Materials
11. Durability of Bituminous Materials
12. Pavement Design

I think that the content is very useful for future jobs, especially in the civil or structural field.
reviews.comment_teaching: He teaches well. I can understand the content easily. He is also very nice. Don't know why only 9 people took this course in this semester. Maybe because it is a 9:00 am class and there was no review about this course before.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. 5 homework (25%)
2. 2 Lab report (15%)
3. Final exam (60%)

The score of the final exam was not released. Nevertheless, I think the grade is quite good.
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload is lighter than normal 3-credit course.

No mid-term.

There is 4 lab. 3 was held in tutorial times and 1 of them was held in the lecture time. Although there were 4 labs, we only need to write one report for lab 1, and 1 report for lab 3 and 4. The reports were done by a group of 4 or 5 people. It did not take much time to complete.

The final exam is open-booked and professor allowed us to bring our computer to the exam venue to read notes so that we don't need to print out the notes.

No attendance was needed (except lab sessions). And he provided recordings for lectures and tutorials.
